meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of the Archaean Eon, the earliest eon in the history of the Earth.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the archaean rocks to learn about the Earth's ancient past.
meanings.sent2: The archaean fossils found in the sediment provide valuable information about early life forms.
meanings.sent3: The archaean rocks whispered tales of the Earth's beginnings to the curious geologist.
meanings.sent4: The archaean landscape resembled a time capsule, preserving secrets of the distant past.
meanings.sent5: The archaean artifacts painted a vivid picture of the primordial world.

meanings.definition: A member of the Archaean group of microorganisms.
meanings.sent1: The scientist discovered a new archaean species thriving in extreme environments.
meanings.sent2: Archaean microorganisms play a crucial role in the ecosystem's balance.
meanings.sent3: The archaean microbes threw a tiny party under the microscope's lens.
meanings.sent4: The archaean organism danced in harmony with nature's rhythms.
meanings.sent5: The archaean cell pulsated with life under the scientist's gaze.
